channel.title: Wolfenstein3D help?
channel.description:
I've been without internet for quite a while recently, and when I have it it is very off and on and slow. So I have been trying to compile and run wolfenstein3d on my computer so I can play it. I can make it compile just fine, with only 2 patches, even though from the gentoo post I got all 4 patches. Anyway in compiles and runs fine until I go to play a new game, then it segfaults and even using strace I can't tell what is wrong.
Can anyone else lend a helping hand?
Here is my build system with all required files, all you need to do is run ./build.sh and after that is done ./run.sh. Some of the required packages I had to install on this kubuntu Intrepid machine are in the 'intrepidreqs' file.
http://www.moparisthebest.com/downloads/wolfgl.7z
Any ideas as to the problem? And if anyone runs gentoo can you install it via portage and tell me if it segfaults for you as well?
Thanks. :)
edit:
Home now, same requirements for debian lenny, and it segfaults the same way as well, shit...

item.title: Wolfenstein3D help?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“parabolika, post:11, topic:295757”]Vanilla Gentoo build segfaults immediately for me. It applied the following patches:

[code] * Applying 0.93-gcc.patch … [ ok ]

  • Applying 0.93-sample-rate.patch … [ ok ]
  • Applying 0.93-sprite.patch … [ ok ]
  • Applying wolfgl-0.93-as-needed.patch … [ ok ]
  • Applying 0.93-gcc4.patch … [ ok ][/code][/quote]

Thank you very much. Did you post a bug report for it?

Read full topic

item.title: Wolfenstein3D help?
item.dc:creator: @parabolika parabolika
item.description:
@parabolika wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:10, topic:295757”]Well, I found this file somewhere on the internet:

http://www.moparisthebest.com/downloads/wolf3d-linux.7z

And it seems to run perfectly, although it does not provide the source code and it does not appear to be wolfgl, and instead uses SDL. Strange.

I’d still like to know the reason for the segfault though, if goatee runs gentoo point him here and see if he can install it.[/quote]

Vanilla Gentoo build segfaults immediately for me. It applied the following patches:

[code] * Applying 0.93-gcc.patch … [ ok ]

  • Applying 0.93-sample-rate.patch … [ ok ]
  • Applying 0.93-sprite.patch … [ ok ]
  • Applying wolfgl-0.93-as-needed.patch … [ ok ]
  • Applying 0.93-gcc4.patch … [ ok ][/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Wolfenstein3D help?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Well, I found this file somewhere on the internet:

http://www.moparisthebest.com/downloads/wolf3d-linux.7z

And it seems to run perfectly, although it does not provide the source code and it does not appear to be wolfgl, and instead uses SDL. Strange.

I’d still like to know the reason for the segfault though, if goatee runs gentoo point him here and see if he can install it.

Read full topic

item.title: Wolfenstein3D help?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

la­wl:

welcome to linux. half the shit doesnt compile/run properly when you build from source

Most things that weren’t written in 1990 do. At least programs with source code provide the possibility to fix the code and make it work.

Your average windows game, with no source code, written that long ago simply doesn’t work at all and never will again.

So given those choices, I’ll take my open source game, thanks.

back on topic:
No one on here runs gentoo anymore?

Read full topic
